alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 20 at 2:34AM MDT until March 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches in the western Uinta mountains and 12 to 24 inches elsewhere in the northern mountains with locally higher amounts up to 30 inches possible in the Upper Cottonwoods. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible with locally higher amounts possible in the Upper Cottonwoods. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 3 AM MDT Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday evening through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
